intro: Pimpinella coriacea, commonly known as the rough pimpinella, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its hairy, rough texture gives it a distinctive appearance, and it is often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Pimpinella coriacea is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
